::Squizzy::

She nodded. "I agree, It's not the just the body, but the mind of the 
bot that needs to be nature oriented. But then, how do we do this? 
You can give a bot a body, but a mind?" She shook her head. 
"Something about that..I don't like.  If I had found out that you had 
made me, created my to be perfect in body, I would be gratefull and 
show great loyalty.  But if I found that you made my mind to think 
tha way that you programmed, that my thoughts were not truely my own, 
I'd go balistic.  No,  There has to be another way."  She thought, 
then her eyes lit up as the idea ran across her mind,"THAT'S IT!"  we 
don't program it. We teach it.  Give the bot the body of the perfect 
warrior,but the innocent mind of a child.  Then we teach it was we 
want it to know.  Then it will grow and learn on it's own, not just 
obey a program. but we can program it to be open minded, show 
tenancies to be caring, wanting to learn, appreciate learning and 
scientific learning."  She was smiling really hard at this. 





--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> Lady Hawk was frustrated by the annoying call from Squizzy, she was 
so close

thoughts
> and reminded herself on why she was there. She was there to help 
her father
> find a way to unite the factions, not hack files. Sheshut down the 
computer,
> stood up and started toward the door. "I'm on my way" She hoped the 
bot
> wasn't to badly hurt she was a science bot not a doctor. It was 
just more
> DNA to her regaurdless of the bots faction it still had DNA and 
that made it
> worth helping.
> 
> " how bad is it?" She asked as she entered the CR room, the bot 
didn't look
> to injured just a damaged leg. the CR chamber should be able to 
handle the
> damage easy enough so she didn't worry to much. She aproached 
Squizzy with
> caution knowing how mongooses loved Hawks.
> 
>  "You know, the more I think about it, the more I like your idea of 
making
> the bots to better suit  the eco system around here." Squizzy said 
as Lady
> Hawk aproached " but even with
> the perfect body, it's the mond of the bot that makes me cringe. 
How can we
> make a bot's mind so he or she will be nature oriented?" The young 
bots
> points were a valid concern, A concern that Veratis had thought of 
multiple
> times.
> 
> Lady Hawkchose her words carefully so she didn't reveal the full 
idea. "That
> is the difference between who I want to obtain the technology and 
who would
> abuse the technology."  She watched the readings on the CR chamber 
wondering
> what the new bot knew about this war."If the technology was abused 
we'd just
> have a more violent form of war to fight. No instincts to induce 
fear means
> no fear to hold a bot back." she shuddered to think about what 
Zardus would
> do with the technology but knew that when her fathers goal was 
reached there
> wouldn't be anything to worry about.
